title: PSG 4-0 Angers: Thomas Tuchel's side enjoy easy win as Parisiens' extend lead at top of Ligue 1
text:
PSG barely entered second gear as they cruised to a comfortable victory over Angers and extended their lead at the top of Ligue 1.

Goals from Pablo Sarabia, Mauro Icardi, Idrissa Gueye and Neymar gave the Parisiens a routine win over an Angers side who failed to pose any real threat throughout the game at Parc des Princes.

PSG are now five points clear at the top of the table ahead of second-placed Nantes who play on Saturday evening against Nice.

Argentinian Mauro Icardi celebrates after putting PSG two up in the first half against Angers

Icardi's strike was preceded by Pablo Sarabia's opener which set PSG on their way to victory

Neymar wrapping up the three points after coolly rounding Angers goalkeeper Ludovic Butelle

Sarabia was the first on target at Parc des Princes as PSG's new recruits continued their smooth integration into the side.

In addition to his first half goal, the Argentinian capped a fine display in blue, red and white with two assists.

Icardi and Gueye followed up Sarabia's opener either side of half-time, as they helped Thomas Tuchel's table-toppers to 21 points from nine games.

Neymar also produced a convincing display, freeing space for his new team-mates to shine in the absence of the injured Kylian Mbappe and Edinson Cavani.

The Brazilian forward wrapped up a bright, but for long spells frustrating individual display, with a deserved strike in injury time, sealing the all-important three points for PSG.

Angers were always on the back foot and could not withstand PSG's quality in the final third

Neymar missed a number of great opportunities to score before finally bagging in injury time

The result means PSG have plenty of breathing room - five points - from second-placed Nantes
description: PSG barely entered second gear as they cruised to a comfortable win over Angers, extending their lead at the top of Ligue 1. The Parisiens are now five points clear.
